alert.note: Alert for Monroe; St. Clair (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 30 at 6:31PM CDT until June 30 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Monroe County in southwestern Illinois... Central St. Clair County in southwestern Illinois... Northeastern Jefferson County in east central Missouri... South central St. Louis County in east central Missouri... * Until 730 PM CDT. * At 631 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Arnold, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Belleville, Arnold, Crestwood, Waterloo, Columbia, Sunset Hills, Pevely, Freeburg, Dupo, Fenton, Millstadt, Lakeshire, Oakland, Barnhart, Affton, Lemay, Mehlville, Oakville, Antonia, and Murphy. This includes Interstate 55 in Missouri between exits 185 and 191. This also includes Mastodon Historic Site and Gov. Dunklin`s Grave Historic Site. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in St Louis.
